title: Goldsmith's Friend Abroad Again
creator: Mark Twain
description: LibriVox recording of Goldsmith's Friend Abroad Again by Mark Twain. Read by John Greenman. This satire on the U.S.A.'s myth of being the "Home of the Oppressed, where all men are free and equal", is unrelenting in its pursuit of justice through exposure. It draws a scathingly shameful portrait of how Chinese immigrants were treated in 19th century San Francisco. (Introduction by John Greenman) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books, or to become a volunteer reader, please visit LibriVox.org. Download M4B (17MB)
subject: librivox; audio; twain; fiction
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
